m_szDocSumamry: Government awards controversial £633m 'follow on' train franchise   comments Passengers have been promised improved services after ministers awarded a controversial £633million subsidised ‘follow-on' rail franchise for 22-months covering services to key northern cities. Under the deal Northern Rail Ltd - which has operated the lines for a decade - will carry on running trains across the north of England until February 2016. A new long-term franchise will then be let by open competitive tender. The current franchise deal was due to expire on April 1. Rail minister Stephen Hammond said Northern
